input_text:
Job Title: Sr. Director Supply Management Solutions

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Distribution, Project Management, Quality Assurance

Description:
Careers that Change Lives

The Supply Management Solutions leader will provide the tools, technologies and processes to support the execution of Global Supply Management day to day run the business programs while also developing innovative strategies for the future roadmap and strategic needs.The Supply Management Solutions leader will lead a team focused on innovation and customer service to provide solutions to the Global Supply Management cross-functional teams.The Supply Management Solutions Leader will spearhead the development and execution of business-critical supply assurance projects, inclusive of cross-functional team members across Global Supply Management. This position requires strong communication skills to influence functional leads across Global Supply Management to champion effective and durable solutions. This role is a key member of the Global Supply Management leadership team and will partner closely with other functional leaders to align business needs to Supply Management strategies.

A Day in the Life

Develop, prioritize and execute a Materials Supply Management roadmap for operational analytics, predictive modeling and insights.Lead development and governance of global processes standards and technologies for Supply Management, including improvement.Utilize key operational and transactional data to derive actionable insights that will improve operational performance. Make improvement recommendations (supported by data and metrics) to Executive Leadership TeamOversee the creation of appropriate monitoring mechanisms to measure results against goals and provide insight into corrective actions or incremental opportunities within the framework of business reviews.Proactively identifies and creates opportunities to embed insights, influence decision making across functional areas, efficient sharing and strategic adoption of best practices.Evaluate and communicate to senior management trends and emerging issues affecting current business strategies and indicate new strategic opportunities.Drive standard work practices and language by providing a common infrastructure design via the creation of technology solutions.Provide vision, leadership and direction for the Supply Management Centers of Excellence including Contracts and e-Sourcing.Evaluate, create and drive standard "best practice" processes and continuously improve/ leverage existing processes.Manage deployment and adoption of new processes and systems utilizing effective and efficient tools/ templates.Focal areas include processes that improve the following:Ariba / RFxSpend & Supplier Dashboards & ReportingCommodity Market ReportingEnable Global Supply Management project teams by establishing / providing metrics that drive the desired performance (both internal & external (ie scorecard).Establish and continuously improve sourcing solution strategy.Develop talent and manage performance.This includes individual development planning, mentoring, succession planning and creating a positive working environment that enables inclusion, high productivity and employee engagement.


Must Have: Minimum Requirements

 Requires a Baccalaureate degree (or for degrees earned outside of the United States, a degree which satisfies the requirements of 8 C.F.R.214.2(h)( 4)(iii)(A) and minimum of 15 years of relevant experience with 10+ years of managerial experience , or advanced degree with a minimum 13 years prior relevant experience, minimum of 10 years of managerial experience Experience in negotiations and supplier relationship management Requires advanced management and leadership knowledge to lead cross-department project teams or manage across multiple functions.


Nice to Have

 BS/BA Degree in Business Management, Supply Chain, or Engineering Project Management and Six-Sigma Methodologies CPIM, CPSM, or C.P.M. Certification Experience with detailed cost models and financial analysis Knowledge of e-commerce initiatives Knowledge of FDA regulated industries Advanced skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently. Excellent communication skills Previous experience in a medical device industry Previous experience in leadership role within a multi-plant, matrix organization Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative/integrative style of working to accomplish objective. Proven track record of building credible, reliable, customer focused sources of supply. Possesses a decisive goal oriented and priority focus approach. Views teamwork and cross functional partnership as a primary means to achieve objectives. Demonstrates strong business acumen and a bias for action.


About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)

 A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create.  We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage. Learn more about our benefits   here   . 

 This position is eligible for a short-term incentive plan.  Learn more about Medtronic Incentive Plan (MIP) on page 6   here  .

 The provided base salary range is used nationally (except in certain CA locations). The rate offered is compliant with federal/local regulations and may vary by experience, certification/education, market conditions, location, etc.    

LTI Eligible: This position is eligible for an annual long-term incentive plan. Learn more about Medtronic Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) here .

Experience Level (if available): Director

output_json.title: Sr. Director Supply Management Solutions
output_json.summary: Leadership role focusing on tools, technologies, and processes to support Global Supply Management operations and strategy.
job_responsibilities: Leads global process standards and technology development
Analyzes operational and transactional data for actionable insights
Improves operational performance through data-driven recommendations
Oversees monitoring mechanisms for result measurement
Identifies and creates opportunities for strategic adoption
Communicates trends and issues to senior management
Drives standard work practices and technology solutions
Evaluates and establishes best practice processes
Improves performance metrics for internal and external stakeholders
Aligns business needs with Supply Management strategies

output_json.company_information: Medtronic is a global healthcare company that aims to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life through innovative technologies, therapies, and services.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Medtronic is committed to equal opportunity in employment and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
